translated: The dedication to train in the manner of the Bodhisattvas, such as Samantabhadra, is by way of the purity of conduct of body, speech, and mind, of field, and of aspiration. This is stated in three verses:🔽The eldest son of all the Victorious Ones,

original: rgyal ba kun gyi sras kyi thu thog / zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal ba kun gyi sras kyi thu thog / zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: and so on.

original: tshad dang sbyor ba dang yon tan dang spyod pa dang gnas kyi bye brag gis kun du bsdu ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: tshad dang sbyor ba dang yon tan dang spyod pa dang gnas kyi bye brag gis kun du bsdu ba gsungs pa /
translated: The summary by way of measure, application, good qualities, conduct, and abode is stated:🔽May my conduct not be limited in measure,

original: spyod pa dag ni tshad yod ma gyur cig / ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: spyod pa dag ni tshad yod ma gyur cig / ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: and so on.

original: de la smon lam gyi mtha' med pa'i dpe ni rnam pa bzhir gsungs te /
analyzed: de la smon lam gyi mtha' med pa'i dpe ni rnam pa bzhir gsungs te /
translated: The four examples of the infinity of prayers are stated in the verse:

original: nam mkha'i mthar thug gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha'i mthar thug gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The end of space is not reached, etc.

original: smon lam gyi legs pa ni yon tan rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: smon lam gyi legs pa ni yon tan rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The excellence of prayers is twofold:

original: tshe 'di dang / phyi ma'o //
analyzed: tshe 'di dang / phyi ma'o //
translated: in this life and in future lives.

original: de la tshe 'di'i rnam pa bzhi ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la tshe 'di'i rnam pa bzhi ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The four in this life are:

original: bsod nams kyi tshogs yongs su gzung ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang skal pa mnyam pa rnyed pa dang / las kyi sgrib pa yongs su zad pa'o //
analyzed: bsod nams kyi tshogs yongs su gzung ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang skal pa mnyam pa rnyed pa dang / las kyi sgrib pa yongs su zad pa'o //
translated: the acquisition of the equipment of merit, seeing the Tathagata, obtaining the fortune of being a Bodhisattva, and the exhaustion of the obscurations of karma.🔽The excellence of prayers in future lives is stated in the verse:

original: de la mang po dang / rgya che ba dang / sna tshogs pa dang / rjes su gzung pa dang / dngos po dang / zhing dam pa'i bsod nams kyi dpe dang / byang chub 'dod pa dang / smon lam la mos pas bsod nams kyi mchog dam pa yongs su 'dzin par gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: de la mang po dang / rgya che ba dang / sna tshogs pa dang / rjes su gzung pa dang / dngos po dang / zhing dam pa'i bsod nams kyi dpe dang / byang chub 'dod pa dang / smon lam la mos pas bsod nams kyi mchog dam pa yongs su 'dzin par gsungs pa ste /
translated: The acquisition of the supreme and holy merit, the desire for enlightenment, and the faith in prayers, through the examples of the holy merit of the many, the vast, the various, the accepted, the things, and the field.

original: gang yang phyogs bcu'i zhing rnams mtha' yas pa //
analyzed: gang yang phyogs bcu'i zhing rnams mtha' yas pa //
translated: And also:

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //🔽ngan song dang log pa'i grogs po yongs su @184a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o // ngan song dang log pa'i grogs po yongs su @184a * //
translated: The infinite buddha-fields in the ten directions.

original: spangs pas de bzhin gshegs pa mthong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: spangs pas de bzhin gshegs pa mthong bar 'gyur te /
translated: By completely avoiding bad rebirths and bad friends, one sees the Tathagatas.🔽And it is said:

original: des ni ngan song thams cad spang bar 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: des ni ngan song thams cad spang bar 'gyur // zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: By that, all bad rebirths are abandoned.🔽And by obtaining praise, one obtains the same lot in life as the Bodhisattvas.

original: rab tu bsngags pa rnyed pa 'tsho ba'i tshe 'thob pas byang chub sems dpa' dang skal ba mnyam pa rnyed par gsungs te /
analyzed: rab tu bsngags pa rnyed pa 'tsho ba'i tshe 'thob pas byang chub sems dpa' dang skal ba mnyam pa rnyed par gsungs te /
translated: It is said:

original: de dag rnyed pa rab rnyed bde bar 'tsho //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag rnyed pa rab rnyed bde bar 'tsho // zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: They obtain the best of gains and live happily.

original: las kyi sgrib pa yongs su zad pa'i yon tan legs pa bzhi pa ni gang gsungs pa /
analyzed: las kyi sgrib pa yongs su zad pa'i yon tan legs pa bzhi pa ni gang gsungs pa /
translated: The fourth good quality of the complete destruction of the obscurations of karma is as follows.🔽It is said:

original: mtshams med lnga po dag gi sdig pa rnams //
analyzed: mtshams med lnga po dag gi sdig pa rnams //
translated: The sins of the five deadly sins

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: and so on.

original: phyi ma'i yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: phyi ma'i yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The future has two aspects:

original: rgyus bsdus pa dang / 'bras bus bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: rgyus bsdus pa dang / 'bras bus bsdus pa'o //
translated: the aspect of cause and the aspect of effect.

original: de la rgyus bsdus pa ni //
analyzed: de la rgyus bsdus pa ni //
translated: The aspect of cause is as follows.

original: ye shes dang mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po'i lus dang nad med pa'i lus kyi mtshan nyid du gang gsungs pa /
analyzed: ye shes dang mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po'i lus dang nad med pa'i lus kyi mtshan nyid du gang gsungs pa /
translated: The body of intuition, the body of marks and signs, and the body of health are taught as the characteristics of the body of attributes.

original: ye shes dang ni gzugs dang mtshan zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes dang ni gzugs dang mtshan zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The body of intuition, the body of form, the body of marks, and so forth.

original: 'bras bus bsdus pa ni byang chub kyi snying por 'gro ba dang / seng ge'i khri la 'dug par ston pa dang / bdud rnams rab tu pham pa dang / mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'bras bus bsdus pa ni byang chub kyi snying por 'gro ba dang / seng ge'i khri la 'dug par ston pa dang / bdud rnams rab tu pham pa dang / mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du gsungs pa /
translated: The included in the effect is taught as the characteristics of going to the site of enlightenment, sitting on the lion throne, conquering Mara, fully awakening, turning the wheel of the doctrine, and so forth.

original: byang chub shing dbang drung du de myur zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub shing dbang drung du de myur zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: He quickly goes to the site of the tree of enlightenment, and so forth.

original: mdor na 'jig rten gyi dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sbyor ba thob pa ni legs pa'o //🔽gang yang bzang po spyod pa'i smon lam 'di //
analyzed: mdor na 'jig rten gyi dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sbyor ba thob pa ni legs pa'o // gang yang bzang po spyod pa'i smon lam 'di //
translated: In brief, the attainment of mundane and supramundane preparations is good.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: And also, This prayer of good practice, and so forth.

original: 'di man chad kyi bsngo ba gsum ni byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i sgrib pa med pas pha rol tu phyin pa dang mthun pa'i lus 'dzin cing smon lam yongs su rdzogs pas 'jig rten na gnas te sems can gyis don sgrub par gsungs
analyzed: 'di man chad kyi bsngo ba gsum ni byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i sgrib pa med pas pha rol tu phyin pa dang mthun pa'i lus 'dzin cing smon lam yongs su rdzogs pas 'jig rten na gnas te sems can gyis don sgrub par gsungs
translated: The next three dedications are said to be for bodhisattvas who have been prophesied by the tathagatas, who have attained the perfection of the unobstructed, who take on bodies in accordance with the perfections, who abide in the world through the fulfillment of their aspirations, and who accomplish the welfare of sentient beings.

original: pa / 'jam dpal ji ltar mkhyen cing dpa' ba zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /🔽'jig rten ji srid sems can phan par bgyi //
analyzed: pa / 'jam dpal ji ltar mkhyen cing dpa' ba zhes bya ba nas bzung ste / 'jig rten ji srid sems can phan par bgyi //
translated: They are from the section beginning with “Manjushri, just as you know and are heroic”

original: zhes bya ba'i bar rnams so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i bar rnams so //
translated: up to “As long as the world exists, I will benefit sentient beings.”

original: kun du bzang po'i spyod pa'i smon lam gyi don kun bsdus pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: kun du bzang po'i spyod pa'i smon lam gyi don kun bsdus pa rdzogs so /
translated: This completes the Compendium of the Meaning of the Vows of Good Conduct.

original: // / sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: // / sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to all the buddhas and bodhisattvas.

original: bzang po spyod pa'i smon lam gyi bsdus pa'i don ni rnam pa bcu'o //
analyzed: bzang po spyod pa'i smon lam gyi bsdus pa'i don ni rnam pa bcu'o //
translated: The meaning of the Good Conduct Prayer is summarized in ten points.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la phyag bya ba dang / de la mchod @184b pa dang / sdig pa bshags pa dang / bsod nams kyi rjes su yi rang ba dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar bskul ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa bzhugs par gsol ba dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la phyag bya ba dang / de la mchod @184b pa dang / sdig pa bshags pa dang / bsod nams kyi rjes su yi rang ba dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar bskul ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa bzhugs par gsol ba dang /
translated: requesting them to turn the wheel of the Dharma,🔽requesting them to remain,🔽dedication of the roots of virtue,🔽their divisions,🔽their limits,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su bsngo ba dang / de'i rab tu dbye ba dang / de'i mtha' dang / de dag gi legs pa rnams so //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su bsngo ba dang / de'i rab tu dbye ba dang / de'i mtha' dang / de dag gi legs pa rnams so //
translated: and their excellences.

original: de la mi dbye ba'i spyis ni phyogs bcu'i dus gsum gyi zhing thams cad kyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la lus dang ngag dang yid kyis phyag bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la mi dbye ba'i spyis ni phyogs bcu'i dus gsum gyi zhing thams cad kyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la lus dang ngag dang yid kyis phyag bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Among them, the general homage is for the purpose of prostrating with body, speech, and mind to the Bhagavan Buddhas of all realms in the three times of the ten directions.

original: ji snyed su dag ces bya ba la sogs pa bshad do //
analyzed: ji snyed su dag ces bya ba la sogs pa bshad do //
translated: Therefore, it is explained with however many there are... and so forth.

original: ji snyed ces bya ba ni grangs ji tsam pa'i tshad de /
analyzed: ji snyed ces bya ba ni grangs ji tsam pa'i tshad de /
translated: As for however many, it refers to the extent of the number.

original: de dag gi tshad chad par ma gyur pas na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams spyir bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag gi tshad chad par ma gyur pas na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams spyir bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Since that extent is not cut off, it is for the purpose of generally teaching the Bhagavan Buddhas.

original: su dag ces bya ba bshad de /
analyzed: su dag ces bya ba bshad de /
translated: Who?

original: grangs chad pa med pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: grangs chad pa med pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is explained that it is those who are not limited in number.

original: phyogs bcu zhes bya ba ni phyogs bcu'o //
analyzed: phyogs bcu zhes bya ba ni phyogs bcu'o //
translated: The ten directions are the ten directions.

original: 'jig rten gyi zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba rnams so //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba rnams so //
translated: The worlds are the worlds of beings.

original: dus gsum gshegs pa zhes bya ba ni dus gsum gyi kun chub pas te /
analyzed: dus gsum gshegs pa zhes bya ba ni dus gsum gyi kun chub pas te /
translated: Those who have gone in the three times are those who have fully awakened in the three times.

original: dus gsum gyi zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dus gsum gyi zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means those of the three times.

original: mi yi seng ge zhes bya ba la seng ge ni thams cad du bag brkyang zhing gar yang dogs pa med la /
analyzed: mi yi seng ge zhes bya ba la seng ge ni thams cad du bag brkyang zhing gar yang dogs pa med la /
translated: The lion among men is a lion because it is fearless in all places,

original: de dang 'dra ba lhar bcas pa'i 'jig rten na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das seng ge dang yang 'dra la /
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba lhar bcas pa'i 'jig rten na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das seng ge dang yang 'dra la /
translated: and the Buddha Bhagavān is like a lion in the world with its gods.

original: mi yi tshe yang ston pa'i phyir mi yang yin la seng ge yang yin pas mi'i seng ge'o //
analyzed: mi yi tshe yang ston pa'i phyir mi yang yin la seng ge yang yin pas mi'i seng ge'o //
translated: And because he shows the life of a man, he is a man and a lion, so he is a lion among men.

original: bdag gi ma lus de dag thams cad la //
analyzed: bdag gi ma lus de dag thams cad la //
translated: I go for refuge to all of them,

original: zhes bya ba la thams cad ces bya ba ni phyogs gcig tu yang brjod du rung bas na 'dir ni ma lus zhes bya ba brjod do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la thams cad ces bya ba ni phyogs gcig tu yang brjod du rung bas na 'dir ni ma lus zhes bya ba brjod do //
translated: Here, all is a synonym for without exception, since it is suitable to express even a part.

original: lus dang ngag yid dang bas phyag bgyi'o //
analyzed: lus dang ngag yid dang bas phyag bgyi'o //
translated: With body, speech, and mind full of faith, I pay homage.

original: zhes bya ba ni mchog tu dang ba bskyed pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mchog tu dang ba bskyed pa ste /
translated: This is the generation of supreme faith.

original: sems dang ba des bskyed pas na lus dang ngag kyang dang ba'o //
analyzed: sems dang ba des bskyed pas na lus dang ngag kyang dang ba'o //
translated: Since it is generated by that clear mind, the body and speech are also clear.

original: da ni lus la sogs pas phyag bya ba so sor phye ste bshad do //
analyzed: da ni lus la sogs pas phyag bya ba so sor phye ste bshad do //
translated: Now, the homage with the body, etc. is explained individually.

original: de la lus kyi phyag bya ba ni /🔽zhing gi rdul snyed ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de la lus kyi phyag bya ba ni / zhing gi rdul snyed ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Among them, the homage with the body is:🔽As many as there are atoms in the buddha-fields, with that many bodies I pay homage.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rdul snyed kyi lus kyis phyag bya ba'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rdul snyed kyi lus kyis phyag bya ba'o //
translated: With bodies as numerous as the atoms in the buddha-fields, one should pay homage.

original: snyed ces bya ba ni dpe'i rnam grangs te /
analyzed: snyed ces bya ba ni dpe'i rnam grangs te /
translated: The word as many as is a synonym for as many as there are.

original: phyogs bcu dus gsum du gshegs pa'o sangs rgyas kyi zhing ji snyed kyi lus rab tu btud pas phyag bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyogs bcu dus gsum du gshegs pa'o sangs rgyas kyi zhing ji snyed kyi lus rab tu btud pas phyag bya ba'o //
translated: One should pay homage with bodies as numerous as the buddha-fields in the ten directions and three times.

original: rgyal ba kun la rab tu phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: rgyal ba kun la rab tu phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: I pay homage to all the Victors.

original: zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i dgra dang bdud las rgyal bas na sangs @185a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i dgra dang bdud las rgyal bas na sangs @185a * //
translated: It is called buddha because it is the victory over the enemies and demons of the afflictions.🔽

original: rgyas bcom ldan 'das la rgyal ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rgyas bcom ldan 'das la rgyal ba zhes bya ste /
translated: The Blessed One is called the Victorious One because he has conquered the enemies and demons of the afflictions.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad du /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad du /
translated: The Blessed Buddha has said:

original: sdig pa'i chos rnams las rgyal bas //
analyzed: sdig pa'i chos rnams las rgyal bas //
translated: The Victorious One is victorious over evil dharmas,

original: nyer 'grong ni rgyal ba yin //
analyzed: nyer 'grong ni rgyal ba yin //
translated: and he is the one who goes to the highest.

original: zhes gsungs pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: And so on.

original: de ltar dus gsum du gshegs pa'i rgyal ba thams cad la phyag bya'o //🔽bcom ldan 'das gcig la sems kyis dmigs pa na /
analyzed: de ltar dus gsum du gshegs pa'i rgyal ba thams cad la phyag bya'o // bcom ldan 'das gcig la sems kyis dmigs pa na /
translated: Thus, one should pay homage to all the Victors who have gone in the three times.

original: gzhan la ma khyab par 'gyur ro snyam pa la /🔽rgyal ba thams cad yid kyis mngon sum du //
analyzed: gzhan la ma khyab par 'gyur ro snyam pa la / rgyal ba thams cad yid kyis mngon sum du //
translated: One might think, When one focuses the mind on one Blessed One, it will not pervade the others.

original: zhes bya ba bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba bshad do //
translated: To explain this, it is said: All the Victors are directly perceived by the mind.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad re re zhing yang mngon sum du bsam pa'i don to ;
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad re re zhing yang mngon sum du bsam pa'i don to ;
translated: The meaning is that each and every Tathagata is directly perceived.

original: / bzang po spyod pa'i smon lam stobs dag gis //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: / bzang po spyod pa'i smon lam stobs dag gis // zhes bya ba la /
translated: By the power of the aspirations of good conduct,

original: bzang po ni dge ba'o //
analyzed: bzang po ni dge ba'o //
translated: Good means virtuous.

original: bzang po yang yin la spyod pa yang yin pas na bzang po spyod pa ste /
analyzed: bzang po yang yin la spyod pa yang yin pas na bzang po spyod pa ste /
translated: Since it is good and it is conduct, it is good conduct.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is synonymous with the conduct of the bodhisattva.

original: der smon pa'i smon lam yin pas na smon lam zhes bya'o //
analyzed: der smon pa'i smon lam yin pas na smon lam zhes bya'o //
translated: Since it is a vow of aspiration for that, it is called a vow.

original: de'i stobs kyis nyon mongs pa la sogs pas zil gyis mi non cing mi mthun pa'i phyogs bcom pas na stobs dag gis zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i stobs kyis nyon mongs pa la sogs pas zil gyis mi non cing mi mthun pa'i phyogs bcom pas na stobs dag gis zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Since it is not overcome by afflictions, etc., by the power of that, and since it conquers adverse elements, it is called the powers.

original: rnam pa gzhan las ni 'di lta bu'i byed pa mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan las ni 'di lta bu'i byed pa mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because such activity does not occur in any other way.

original: da ni yid kyis phyag bya ba ste /🔽rdul gcig steng na rdul snyed ces bya ba la sogs pa'o ;
analyzed: da ni yid kyis phyag bya ba ste / rdul gcig steng na rdul snyed ces bya ba la sogs pa'o ;
translated: Now, the salutation with the mind is stated:🔽On one atom, as many buddhas as atoms, etc.🔽On one atom, as many buddhas as atoms, etc.

original: / rdul gcig gi steng du rdul snyed kyi sangs rgyas rnam pa zhes bya ba ni khyad par du ma smos pa'i phyir phyogs bcu dus gsum du gshegs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi zhing gi rdul snyed kyis bde bar gshegs pa rnams so //
analyzed: / rdul gcig gi steng du rdul snyed kyi sangs rgyas rnam pa zhes bya ba ni khyad par du ma smos pa'i phyir phyogs bcu dus gsum du gshegs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi zhing gi rdul snyed kyis bde bar gshegs pa rnams so //
translated: Since it is not specified, the sugatas are as many as the atoms in the buddha lands of the buddhas who have gone to the ten directions and three times.

original: sangs rgyas sras kyi dbus na bzhugs pa dag / ces bya ba ni re re zhing yang byang chub sems dpa' grangs med pa'i tshogs kyi dbus na bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas sras kyi dbus na bzhugs pa dag / ces bya ba ni re re zhing yang byang chub sems dpa' grangs med pa'i tshogs kyi dbus na bzhugs pa'o //
translated: This means that each one is seated in the middle of an assembly of countless bodhisattvas.

original: rdul gcig gi steng du ji ltar bsams pa de bzhin du thams cad du bsam par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdul gcig gi steng du ji ltar bsams pa de bzhin du thams cad du bsam par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Just as they are imagined on one atom, so they are imagined everywhere.

original: de ltar chos kyi dbyings rnams ma lus pa //
analyzed: de ltar chos kyi dbyings rnams ma lus pa //
translated: Thus, the entire realm of phenomena

original: zhes bya ba bshad de /
analyzed: zhes bya ba bshad de /
translated: is explained.

translated: the merit of the realization of the generation of the mind of enlightenment, the merit of the perfections, the merit of the bhumis, and so forth,🔽the merit of the immeasurable, inconceivable accumulations of merit of each and every one of the buddhas and transcendent ones of the three times,

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa re re'i bsod nams kyi tshogs tshad med pa bsam du med pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kyi spyod yul du gyur pa de dag thams cad la skad cig re re zhing yang rjes su yi rang bar bya'o //

translated: If the merit of the three times is included in the merit of the buddhas and transcendent ones, why is it mentioned separately?

analyzed: 'gro bas na 'gro ba ste sred pa dang bcas pas 'khor bar 'khor ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Going” means going, i.e., revolving in cyclic existence with craving.

analyzed: de la gang yang 'gro ba med na ji ltar 'gro ba zhes bya /
translated: If there is no going at all, how can there be a goer?

original: de bas na so sor bstan to //
analyzed: de bas na so sor bstan to //
translated: Therefore, it is taught individually.

original: da ni chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar bskul ba bshad de /🔽gang rnams phyogs bcu'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: da ni chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar bskul ba bshad de / gang rnams phyogs bcu'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Now, the exhortation to turn the wheel of the Dharma is explained.

analyzed: gang rnams phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten sgron ma dag / ces bya ba ni 'gro ba'i sgron ma ste //
translated: Those who are the lights of the worlds in the ten directions, etc.

analyzed: 'jig rten gyi phyi dang nang gi mun pa mang po rnam par sel bas na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten gyi sgron ma'o //
translated: The lights of the worlds are the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, because they dispel the many internal and external obscurations of the world.

analyzed: byang chub rim par sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni bla na med pa'i byang chub tu mngon par sangs rgyas pa'o //
translated: They are the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, because they are fully enlightened in unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: ma chags brnyes zhes bya ba ni mngon par byang chub pa'i stobs kyis dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin ma lus par yongs su mkhyen pas chags bar gyur pa thams cad las 'das pa'o //

translated: The phrase having attained nonattachment means that, by the power of manifest enlightenment, he has completely understood the nature of all things, and so he has transcended all attachment.

translated: In order to dispel the darkness of ignorance of all the protectors of the world who are seated at the foot of the excellent tree of enlightenment in the various worlds,

translated: and in order to turn the wheel of the unsurpassed Dharma in order to illuminate the unsurpassed knowledge of the world, one should kneel with one's two knees on the ground, join one's palms in supplication, and exhort him as if he were seated in front.

original: da ni de bzhin @187a * //
analyzed: da ni de bzhin @187a * //
translated: Now, it is like this.🔽

translated: it is connected with “the lamps of the worlds in the ten directions.”

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: tshigs su bcad pa phyed dang bzhi bos ni byang chub kyi sems la mi mthun ba'i phyogs kyis bsgribs par @189a * //🔽gyur ba de dag gi gnyen po bstan pa'o //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa phyed dang bzhi bos ni byang chub kyi sems la mi mthun ba'i phyogs kyis bsgribs par @189a * // gyur ba de dag gi gnyen po bstan pa'o //
translated: The first four and a half verses show the antidotes to the obscurations to the Thought of Enlightenment.

original: da tshigs bcad phyed kyis ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs rab tu spong bar ston te /
analyzed: da tshigs bcad phyed kyis ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs rab tu spong bar ston te /
translated: Now, the next half-verse shows the complete abandonment of the obscurations.

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: sdig ba gang rnams sgrib par gyur ba dag / ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sdig ba gang rnams sgrib par gyur ba dag / ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: All the obscurations of evil and so on.

original: sdig pa sgrib par gyur ba byang chub kyi sems la bar chad byed pa de dag thams cad kun yongs su zad cing spong bar gyur cig ba'o //
analyzed: sdig pa sgrib par gyur ba byang chub kyi sems la bar chad byed pa de dag thams cad kun yongs su zad cing spong bar gyur cig ba'o //
translated: All the obscurations of evil, which are obstacles to the Thought of Enlightenment, are completely exhausted and abandoned.

original: da ni chags pa med par sbyor ba ni rnam pa gsum pa ste /
analyzed: da ni chags pa med par sbyor ba ni rnam pa gsum pa ste /
translated: Now, the application without attachment is threefold:

original: gang las dang / gang na dang / ji ltar dang gsum mo //
analyzed: gang las dang / gang na dang / ji ltar dang gsum mo //
translated: from what, where, and how.

original: las dang nyon mongs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: From what? From karma, from addictions, and so on.

original: gang las she na /
analyzed: gang las she na /
translated: Where?

original: las dang nyon mongs pa dang bdud kyi las rnams las so //
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pa dang bdud kyi las rnams las so //
translated: From the karma, from the addictions, and from the works of Mara.

original: las de dmigs kyis ma phyed pa na dge ba dang mi dge ba dang mi g-yo ba dang rnam pa gsum char gzung ngo //
analyzed: las de dmigs kyis ma phyed pa na dge ba dang mi dge ba dang mi g-yo ba dang rnam pa gsum char gzung ngo //
translated: When that action is not distinguished, all three types are taken up: virtuous, nonvirtuous, and imperturbable.

original: de la mi dge ba'i las dang nyon mongs pa dang bdud kyi las rnams las rnam par grol zhing de dag la mi chags par rtag tu spyod pa ste /
analyzed: de la mi dge ba'i las dang nyon mongs pa dang bdud kyi las rnams las rnam par grol zhing de dag la mi chags par rtag tu spyod pa ste /
translated: Among them, one should always practice being free from nonvirtuous actions, afflictions, and the actions of Mara, and not be attached to them.

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: lha la sogs pa'i 'jig rten 'gro ba na gnas pa'i tshe'o //
analyzed: lha la sogs pa'i 'jig rten 'gro ba na gnas pa'i tshe'o //
translated: When one is living in the world of gods and so forth.

original: ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: ji ltar padmo chus mi chags pa bzhin //🔽zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ji ltar padmo chus mi chags pa bzhin // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Like a lotus that is not attached to water.

original: ji ltar padma chu las skyes kyang chus mi chags pa de bzhin du las dang nyon mongs pa dang bdud kyi las la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi chos rnams kyis mi chags par spyod pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar padma chu las skyes kyang chus mi chags pa de bzhin du las dang nyon mongs pa dang bdud kyi las la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi chos rnams kyis mi chags par spyod pa'o //
translated: Just as a lotus is born from water but is not attached to water, so one should practice without being attached to worldly phenomena such as actions, afflictions, the actions of Mara, and so forth.

original: de ltar dge ba dang mi g-yo ba gnyis las kyang 'bras bu rnam par smin pa la re ba med bar bya zhing chags pa med par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar dge ba dang mi g-yo ba gnyis las kyang 'bras bu rnam par smin pa la re ba med bar bya zhing chags pa med par bya ste /
translated: Thus, one should not hope for the ripened result even from the two virtuous and imperturbable actions, and one should not be attached to them.

original: 'gro ba thams cad la phan zhing bde ba 'ba' zhig spyod cing sgrub pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yin par brjod do //
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad la phan zhing bde ba 'ba' zhig spyod cing sgrub pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yin par brjod do //
translated: The practice of the bodhisattva is said to be the performance and accomplishment of only that which is beneficial and pleasing to all beings.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: dper na / nyi zla nam mkhar thogs pa med ltar spyad //🔽ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: dper na / nyi zla nam mkhar thogs pa med ltar spyad // ces bya ba ste /
translated: Like the sun and moon moving through the sky unhindered.

original: nyi ma dang zla ba ni 'jig rten na yid bzhin gyi nor bu bzhin du gzhan gyi don byed pa la bzhugs shing bdag gi cung zad la'ang mi chags par nyin mtshan du nam mkha' la rgyu ba de dang 'dra bar ro //
analyzed: nyi ma dang zla ba ni 'jig rten na yid bzhin gyi nor bu bzhin du gzhan gyi don byed pa la bzhugs shing bdag gi cung zad la'ang mi chags par nyin mtshan du nam mkha' la rgyu ba de dang 'dra bar ro //
translated: Like the sun and moon, which are in the world like wish-fulfilling gems, engaged in benefiting others, not at all attached to their own concerns, moving through the sky day and night, so it is.

original: de la bdud ces bya ba ni dge ba'i srog gi bar chad byed pas byang chub dang mi mthun par byed cing dam pa'i lam las zlog pa ste /
analyzed: de la bdud ces bya ba ni dge ba'i srog gi bar chad byed pas byang chub dang mi mthun par byed cing dam pa'i lam las zlog pa ste /
translated: Here, “demon” means that which creates obstacles to the life of virtue, which acts in opposition to enlightenment, and which turns one away from the holy path.

original: sgra'i tshul du'ang chos kyis 'tsho ba'i bar chad byed cing gsod pas na bdud ces bya'o //
analyzed: sgra'i tshul du'ang chos kyis 'tsho ba'i bar chad byed cing gsod pas na bdud ces bya'o //
translated: It is also called a “demon” because it creates obstacles to the livelihood of Dharma and kills it, in the manner of a verbal root.

original: @189b de'i las ni phan pa'i dngos po la rgyus 'tshe ba'o //
analyzed: @189b de'i las ni phan pa'i dngos po la rgyus 'tshe ba'o //
translated: Its action is to harm the thing that is beneficial.

original: tshe 'di dang phyi ma la sems can thams cad la phan gdags pa ste rnam pa bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: tshe 'di dang phyi ma la sems can thams cad la phan gdags pa ste rnam pa bzhi pa'o //
translated: The fourth is the benefit of all beings in this life and the next.

original: de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: ngan song sdug bsngal zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ngan song sdug bsngal zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The suffering of the unfortunate realms, etc.

original: 'gro ba thams cad sdig pas sdug bsngal zhing ngan song rnam pa gsum du skyes pa de dag rab tu zhi bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad sdig pas sdug bsngal zhing ngan song rnam pa gsum du skyes pa de dag rab tu zhi bar bya'o //
translated: All beings are suffering because of their sins, and are born in the three unfortunate realms.

original: de la yang ci'i phyir ngan song gi sdug bsngal 'ba' zhig zhi ba zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: de la yang ci'i phyir ngan song gi sdug bsngal 'ba' zhig zhi ba zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it that only the suffering of the unfortunate realms is to be pacified?

original: de dag gis shin tu gnod par byed pas na gtso bor bshad pa yin gyis /
analyzed: de dag gis shin tu gnod par byed pas na gtso bor bshad pa yin gyis /
translated: Because they are very harmful, they are explained as foremost.

original: 'khor ba thams cad kyi sdug bsngal yang de bzhin du rab tu zhi bar bya bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba thams cad kyi sdug bsngal yang de bzhin du rab tu zhi bar bya bar rig par bya'o //
translated: But the suffering of all cyclic existence is to be pacified in the same way.

original: ci'i phyir 'gro ba thams cad mchog tu bde ba la 'god par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'gro ba thams cad mchog tu bde ba la 'god par bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it that all beings are to be established in the highest bliss?

original: de ltar 'gro ba thams cad la phan par spyod par bya ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar 'gro ba thams cad la phan par spyod par bya ba ste /
translated: Thus, the benefit of all beings is to be accomplished.

original: bla na med pa'i ye shes thob kyi bar du yongs su mi skyo ba'i yid kyis gzhan du mi sbyor bar spyod bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i ye shes thob kyi bar du yongs su mi skyo ba'i yid kyis gzhan du mi sbyor bar spyod bar bya ba'o //
translated: One should practice with a mind that is not discouraged until one attains unsurpassed pristine awareness, without applying oneself elsewhere.

original: ji srid kyi bar du zhe na /
analyzed: ji srid kyi bar du zhe na /
translated: For how long?

original: zhing gi khyon dang phyogs rnams ji tsam par zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhing gi khyon dang phyogs rnams ji tsam par zhes bya ba ste /
translated: As far as the extent of the realms and directions.

original: ji tsam par zhes bya ba ni ji srid pa'o //🔽zhing gi khyon zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi khyon ji tsam pa ste /
analyzed: ji tsam par zhes bya ba ni ji srid pa'o // zhing gi khyon zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi khyon ji tsam pa ste /
translated: As far as means for as long as.

original: bskal ba gcig nas gcig tu gnas pa'o //
analyzed: bskal ba gcig nas gcig tu gnas pa'o //
translated: The extent of the realms is the extent of the buddha-realms, which endure from one eon to the next.

original: phyogs zhes bya ba ni phyogs bcur sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: phyogs zhes bya ba ni phyogs bcur sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The directions are to be applied to the ten directions.

original: go cha ba gos pa ni rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: go cha ba gos pa ni rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: The armor is fivefold:

original: de yang rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: It is also threefold:

original: sems can gyi spyod pa'i rjes su 'jug pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / dam pa'i chos rab tu bsgrags pa rnams te /
analyzed: sems can gyi spyod pa'i rjes su 'jug pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / dam pa'i chos rab tu bsgrags pa rnams te /
translated: It is the engagement in the conduct of sentient beings, the completion of the qualities of the Buddha, and the proclamation of the sublime Dharma.

original: de yang gang zhe na ;
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na ;
translated: What is that?

original: sems can dag gi spyod dang mthun par 'jug //
analyzed: sems can dag gi spyod dang mthun par 'jug //
translated: Engaging in accordance with the conduct of sentient beings.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: and so on.

original: sems can rnams la rgyu med pa'i rang bzhin spyod pa dang / bde bar gnas pa dang sems kyi rjes su mthun par 'dzin cing spyod pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams la rgyu med pa'i rang bzhin spyod pa dang / bde bar gnas pa dang sems kyi rjes su mthun par 'dzin cing spyod pa'o //
translated: He is a friend to sentient beings, who are by nature devoid of a cause for happiness, and he is a friend who is in accord with their minds.

original: byang chub spyod pa yongs su rdzogs byed cing //
analyzed: byang chub spyod pa yongs su rdzogs byed cing //
translated: He is the one who perfects the practice of enlightenment.

original: zhes bya ba ni byang chub pa'i don du spyod pa ni byang chub kyi spyod pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni byang chub pa'i don du spyod pa ni byang chub kyi spyod pa ste /
translated: The practice for the sake of enlightenment is the practice of enlightenment.

original: de yongs su rdzogs pa ni sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams 'grub bar byed ba'o //
analyzed: de yongs su rdzogs pa ni sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams 'grub bar byed ba'o //
translated: Its perfection is the accomplishment of the qualities of a Buddha.

original: bzang po spyod ba dag ni rab ston cing //
analyzed: bzang po spyod ba dag ni rab ston cing //
translated: He is the one who teaches the practice of the good.

original: zhes bya ba la 'dir bzang po spyod ba zhes bya ba ni dam pa'i @190a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la 'dir bzang po spyod ba zhes bya ba ni dam pa'i @190a * //
translated: Here, the practice of the good is the teaching of the true Dharma.

original: chos 'chad pa nyid gzung sta thabs kyis sgro btags pa dang / 'chad pa dang / ston pa'o //🔽ma 'ongs bskal ba kun du spyod par gyur //
analyzed: chos 'chad pa nyid gzung sta thabs kyis sgro btags pa dang / 'chad pa dang / ston pa'o // ma 'ongs bskal ba kun du spyod par gyur //
translated: It is the teaching, the demonstration, and the imputation by means of skillful methods.🔽He is the one who will practice in all future ages.

original: ces bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i bskal ba mtha' yas pa thams cad du mi skyo ba'i yid kyis spyod pa'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i bskal ba mtha' yas pa thams cad du mi skyo ba'i yid kyis spyod pa'o //
translated: He is the one who, with an undaunted mind, will practice in all future ages, which are limitless.

original: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi spyod pa dang / smon lam gyis skal pa mnyam pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dang mthun par bstan pa ste de ni rnam pa drug pa'o //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi spyod pa dang / smon lam gyis skal pa mnyam pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dang mthun par bstan pa ste de ni rnam pa drug pa'o //
translated: The sixth is the demonstration of the equality of fortune with the bodhisattvas in terms of the conduct of body, speech, and mind, and in terms of the vow.

original: de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: bdag gi spyod dang mtshungs par gang spyod pa //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gi spyod dang mtshungs par gang spyod pa // zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “May I always be with those who practice the same conduct as I do.”

original: bdag gi byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dang mthun par gang spyod pa de dag dang rtag par nam byang chub pa'i bar du 'grogs pa dang / lus dang ngag dang yid kyis byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dang / smon lam de dang lhan cig tu spyod par shog shig pa'o //🔽phan par bsam pa'i man ngag sgrub pa ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen mgu par byed pa ste /
analyzed: bdag gi byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dang mthun par gang spyod pa de dag dang rtag par nam byang chub pa'i bar du 'grogs pa dang / lus dang ngag dang yid kyis byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dang / smon lam de dang lhan cig tu spyod par shog shig pa'o // phan par bsam pa'i man ngag sgrub pa ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen mgu par byed pa ste /
translated: “I” refers to the bodhisattva. “Those who practice the same conduct as I do” means those who practice the same conduct as the bodhisattva. “Always” means until enlightenment. “With” means with body, speech, and mind. “Practice” means practice of the bodhisattva conduct and the vow.

original: de ni rnam pa bdun pa'o //
analyzed: de ni rnam pa bdun pa'o //
translated: The seventh is the practice of the instruction of the thought of benefit, which is the pleasing of the spiritual friend.

original: de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: bdag la phan par 'dod pa'i grogs po zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag la phan par 'dod pa'i grogs po zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “The friend who wishes me well” and so on.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gang phan par 'dod pas bzang po spyod pa ston pa dang / 'chad pa dang / chos kyi gtam zer ba dang ; bdag rtag par lhan cig tu mtshungs par spyod par gyur cig pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gang phan par 'dod pas bzang po spyod pa ston pa dang / 'chad pa dang / chos kyi gtam zer ba dang ; bdag rtag par lhan cig tu mtshungs par spyod par gyur cig pa'o //
translated: The spiritual teacher is the one who, out of a desire to help, teaches the good conduct, explains it, and talks about the Dharma, and who always remains with me as a companion.

original: de dag bdag gis nams kyang ste gzhar yang yid dbyung bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: de dag bdag gis nams kyang ste gzhar yang yid dbyung bar mi bya ste /
translated: I should never, at any time, be without them.

original: nam byang chub pa'i bar du rtag par de dang mthun par gyur cig pa'o //
analyzed: nam byang chub pa'i bar du rtag par de dang mthun par gyur cig pa'o //
translated: May I always be in harmony with them until enlightenment.

original: dus dang 'khor dang mchod pa bya ba la skyo ba med pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa mngon du byed pa ste de ni rnam pa brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: dus dang 'khor dang mchod pa bya ba la skyo ba med pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa mngon du byed pa ste de ni rnam pa brgyad pa'o //
translated: The absence of weariness in regard to the time, the retinue, and the performance of worship is the direct realization of the Tathagatas. This is the eighth.

original: de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: sangs rgyas sras kyis bskor ba'i mgon po rnams //
analyzed: sangs rgyas sras kyis bskor ba'i mgon po rnams //
translated: The lords surrounded by their children, the Buddhas,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: and so on.

original: mngon sum zhes bya ba ni mngon sum du bya ba ste phyogs bcu kun gyi'o //
analyzed: mngon sum zhes bya ba ni mngon sum du bya ba ste phyogs bcu kun gyi'o //
translated: Directly means directly realized, in all the ten directions.

original: rgyal ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das te /
analyzed: rgyal ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das te /
translated: The Victor is the Lord Buddha.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor gyis bskor ba'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor gyis bskor ba'o //
translated: surrounded by a retinue of Bodhisattvas.

original: mgon po zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba thams cad kyi gnyen gcig pur gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mgon po zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba thams cad kyi gnyen gcig pur gyur pa'o //
translated: The Lord is the sole kinsman of all beings.

original: rtag tu blta zhes bya ba ni skyon med pa'i mig gis so //
analyzed: rtag tu blta zhes bya ba ni skyon med pa'i mig gis so //
translated: The always is with faultless eyes.

original: de dag kun re re la yang rnam pa thams cad dang @190b ldan pa rgya chen po nam mkha' dang mnyam pa chos kyi dbyings kun du khyab pa'i mchod pas mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag kun re re la yang rnam pa thams cad dang @190b ldan pa rgya chen po nam mkha' dang mnyam pa chos kyi dbyings kun du khyab pa'i mchod pas mchod par bya'o //
translated: And each of them is to be worshipped with worship that is vast, like space, all-pervading, and endowed with all aspects.

original: ji srid kyi bar du zhe na /
analyzed: ji srid kyi bar du zhe na /
translated: For how long?

original: ma 'ongs bskal pa kun du mi skyo bar //🔽zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ma 'ongs bskal pa kun du mi skyo bar // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: For all future ages, without weariness.

original: skyo ba med pa'i yid kyis ma 'ongs pa'i bskal ba thams cad kyi mthar thug pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: skyo ba med pa'i yid kyis ma 'ongs pa'i bskal ba thams cad kyi mthar thug pa'i bar du'o //
translated: With an untiring mind, for all future ages, until the end of time.

original: 'dzin pa dang / bshad pa dang / yongs su sbyang ba dang gsum ni dam pa'i chos yongs su bsdu ba ste de ni rnam pa dgu pa'o //
analyzed: 'dzin pa dang / bshad pa dang / yongs su sbyang ba dang gsum ni dam pa'i chos yongs su bsdu ba ste de ni rnam pa dgu pa'o //
translated: The three are the Dharma-collection, the explanation, and the purification. This is the ninth aspect.

original: de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: rgyal ba rnams kyi dam pa'i chos 'dzin cing //
analyzed: rgyal ba rnams kyi dam pa'i chos 'dzin cing //
translated: The Dharma of the Victorious Ones is upheld,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dus gsum du gshegs pa'i rgyal ba thams cad kyi gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis po bshad pa'i chos de dag gzungs kyi stobs kyis 'dzin pas na 'dzin cing zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dus gsum du gshegs pa'i rgyal ba thams cad kyi gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis po bshad pa'i chos de dag gzungs kyi stobs kyis 'dzin pas na 'dzin cing zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The words and so on refer to the scriptures of all the Victors who have gone in the three times, the twelve branches of the scriptures, which are the Dharma to be explained. Because he holds them by the power of memory, he is called the holder.

original: byang chub spyod pa ni bsgrag par bya ba'i chos nyid de /
analyzed: byang chub spyod pa ni bsgrag par bya ba'i chos nyid de /
translated: The conduct of enlightenment is the Dharma to be proclaimed.

original: kun du snang bar byed ces bya ba ni 'gro ba rnams la yongs su bsgrags shing rab tu bstan pa'o //
analyzed: kun du snang bar byed ces bya ba ni 'gro ba rnams la yongs su bsgrags shing rab tu bstan pa'o //
translated: The words he illuminates mean that he proclaims and teaches it to beings.

original: bzang po spyod pa rnam par sbyang ba yang //
analyzed: bzang po spyod pa rnam par sbyang ba yang //
translated: He purifies the conduct of goodness.

original: zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'o //
translated: The conduct of the bodhisattva.

original: de rnams rnam par sbyang ba ni dri ma med par bya ba ste /
analyzed: de rnams rnam par sbyang ba ni dri ma med par bya ba ste /
translated: The words he purifies mean he makes stainless.

original: nyes pa thams cad ring du spong ba'o //
analyzed: nyes pa thams cad ring du spong ba'o //
translated: He abandons all faults.

original: ma 'ongs bskal pa kun du spyad par bgyi //
analyzed: ma 'ongs bskal pa kun du spyad par bgyi //
translated: He practices in all future ages.

original: zhes bya ba ni de ltar brtsal ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de ltar brtsal ba'o //
translated: The words he practices mean that he strives in that way.

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs la sogs pa'i chogs thob pas mi zad pa'i mdzod rnyed pa ste 'di ni rnam pa bcu pa'o //
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs la sogs pa'i chogs thob pas mi zad pa'i mdzod rnyed pa ste 'di ni rnam pa bcu pa'o //

original: sgyu mar gyur ba'i rnam thar stobs kyis 'jug / ces bya ba ni sgyu mar gyur pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar ba ye shes kyi bdag nyid de'i mthus rtag par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: sgyu mar gyur ba'i rnam thar stobs kyis 'jug / ces bya ba ni sgyu mar gyur pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar ba ye shes kyi bdag nyid de'i mthus rtag par 'jug pa'o //
translated: The bodhisattva enters by the power of that knowledge which is the bodhisattvas liberation that is like an illusion.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing mngon par sgrub par 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing mngon par sgrub par 'jug pa ste /
translated: and to engage in the creation of a buddha land.

original: de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: gang yang dus gsum dag gi zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang yang dus gsum dag gi zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is the adornment of the lands of the three times, etc.

original: gang yang dus gsum dag gi zhing gi rgyan ni zhing mang po ste /
analyzed: gang yang dus gsum dag gi zhing gi rgyan ni zhing mang po ste /
translated: The adornment of the lands of the three times is the many lands.

original: de dag mngon par bsgrub ces bya ba ni rdzu 'phrul gyi stobs kyis rdul gcig gi steng du mngon par bsgrub pa'o ;
analyzed: de dag mngon par bsgrub ces bya ba ni rdzu 'phrul gyi stobs kyis rdul gcig gi steng du mngon par bsgrub pa'o ;
translated: To create them means to create them on a single atom through the power of magic.

original: / de ltar ma lus phyogs rnams thams cad du //
analyzed: / de ltar ma lus phyogs rnams thams cad du //
translated: Thus, in all directions without exception

original: zhes bya ba ni ji ltar ma lus pa'i phyogs kyi rdul gyi steng du sgrub pa de bzhin du ye shes kyi skad cig ma gcig gis zhing mang po rnams mngon par bsgrubs nas 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ji ltar ma lus pa'i phyogs kyi rdul gyi steng du sgrub pa de bzhin du ye shes kyi skad cig ma gcig gis zhing mang po rnams mngon par bsgrubs nas 'jug pa'o //
translated: means that just as they are created on atoms in all directions without exception, in the same way, in a single instant of wisdom, they engage in the creation of many lands.

original: da ltar gyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid dang / tshad dang / kha dog dang / dbyibs dag so sor tha dad pa mang po ma 'dres pa rnams kyang rdul gcig gi steng du bzhag par mi rung na /
analyzed: da ltar gyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid dang / tshad dang / kha dog dang / dbyibs dag so sor tha dad pa mang po ma 'dres pa rnams kyang rdul gcig gi steng du bzhag par mi rung na /
translated: If it is not possible to place on a single particle the many different natures, sizes, colors, and shapes of all the present buddhafields,

original: so sor tha dad pa mang po rnams rdul gcig gi steng du phyogs bcu mtshams med cing ma 'dres par ji ltar gzhag par bya /
analyzed: so sor tha dad pa mang po rnams rdul gcig gi steng du phyogs bcu mtshams med cing ma 'dres par ji ltar gzhag par bya /
translated: how could one place on a single particle the many different directions and parts of the ten directions without mixing them?

original: de lta pas na 'di la ji ltar yid ches par bya snyam pa la /
analyzed: de lta pas na 'di la ji ltar yid ches par bya snyam pa la /
translated: Therefore, how can one have confidence in this?🔽In response to that, it is said:

original: de'i lan du de bas na chos thams cad ni yongs su ma rdzogs pa ste /
analyzed: de'i lan du de bas na chos thams cad ni yongs su ma rdzogs pa ste /
translated: Therefore, all phenomena are incomplete.

original: ngo bo nyid med pa sgyu ma lta bu ma skyes pa /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa sgyu ma lta bu ma skyes pa /
translated: They are like illusions, without an essence, unborn,

original: ma 'gags pa /
analyzed: ma 'gags pa /
translated: and unceasing.

original: skra shad 'dzings pa lta bur thog ma nas zhi zhing rang bzhin gyis sems las 'das pa la ji @193a * //
analyzed: skra shad 'dzings pa lta bur thog ma nas zhi zhing rang bzhin gyis sems las 'das pa la ji @193a * //
translated: Like matted hair, they are peaceful from the beginning, and by nature they transcend the mind.

original: ltar mos par brtags pa tsam gyis 'byung ba ni rnam pa sna tshogs du ma'i gzugs su rab tu bsgoms pas rnam pa mang po'i ting nge 'dzin dang / rnam par grol ba'i khyad par gyis bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rnam pa sna tshogs myong bas na dngos po 'di dag par du gsal bar snang ngo ;
analyzed: ltar mos par brtags pa tsam gyis 'byung ba ni rnam pa sna tshogs du ma'i gzugs su rab tu bsgoms pas rnam pa mang po'i ting nge 'dzin dang / rnam par grol ba'i khyad par gyis bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rnam pa sna tshogs myong bas na dngos po 'di dag par du gsal bar snang ngo ;
translated: The experience of the inconceivable variety of aspects is the manifestation of these things in various ways.

original: /'jig rten na yang sngags cung zad tsam las mthu skyes pa'i mig 'phrul gyis rab tu bsgrubs na ngo mtshar dang ldan pa'i sgyu ma'i mdzes pa yang snang ngo //
analyzed: /'jig rten na yang sngags cung zad tsam las mthu skyes pa'i mig 'phrul gyis rab tu bsgrubs na ngo mtshar dang ldan pa'i sgyu ma'i mdzes pa yang snang ngo //
translated: In the world, too, when a magician has accomplished a little magic power through the practice of a few spells, the beautiful illusions that appear are amazing.

original: de lta bas na 'di dag thams cad ni ji ltar smras pa bzhin yid ches par bya ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di dag thams cad ni ji ltar smras pa bzhin yid ches par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, all of this should be accepted as it is said.🔽Thus, do not have any doubts at all.

original: 'di ltar yid gnyis ni cung zad kyang ma byed cig / de bzhin gshegs pa la bsnyen bkur bya bar 'jug pa dang brgyad de /
analyzed: 'di ltar yid gnyis ni cung zad kyang ma byed cig / de bzhin gshegs pa la bsnyen bkur bya bar 'jug pa dang brgyad de /
translated: There are eight more topics for engaging in service to the Tathāgata.

original: de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: gang yang ma byon zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gang yang ma byon zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: They are the topics beginning with “those who have not yet come.”

original: gang ma byon pa ni phyi ma ma 'ongs pa'i mthar thug pa rnams so //
analyzed: gang ma byon pa ni phyi ma ma 'ongs pa'i mthar thug pa rnams so //
translated: Those who have not yet come are those in the future, up to the end of time.

original: 'jig rten sgron ma zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams te /🔽phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan dang gzhan na nam mkha'i mtha' klas pa na bzhugs pa bgrang ba las 'das pa'i sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kyi spyod yul gyis skad cig gis dus mnyam par bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon
analyzed: 'jig rten sgron ma zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams te / phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan dang gzhan na nam mkha'i mtha' klas pa na bzhugs pa bgrang ba las 'das pa'i sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kyi spyod yul gyis skad cig gis dus mnyam par bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon
translated: The “lamps of the world” are the Bhagavan Buddhas.🔽In other and other world systems of the ten directions, in the infinite reaches of space, they are beyond enumeration.

original: par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa ste /
analyzed: par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa ste /
translated: The wisdom of the Buddha, in a single instant, simultaneously in all times, fully and perfectly awakens to unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: de nas 'di bzhin du dus mnyam par chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa ston par bshad de /
analyzed: de nas 'di bzhin du dus mnyam par chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa ston par bshad de /
translated: Then, in the same way, they turn the wheel of the Dharma and likewise demonstrate nirvana.

original: de dag mngon sum du byang chub ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag mngon sum du byang chub ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: This is explained in the lines beginning “Then, they directly awaken…” and so forth.

original: de dag ces bya ba ni de ltar mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par mdzad pa dang / de de bzhin du chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar mdzad pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa rnam pa rab tu ston pa'i mgon po thams cad kyi zhabs kyi drung du yid myur ba dang /
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni de ltar mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par mdzad pa dang / de de bzhin du chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar mdzad pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa rnam pa rab tu ston pa'i mgon po thams cad kyi zhabs kyi drung du yid myur ba dang /
translated: The phrase all of them refers to all the lords who have acted in this way to fully awaken, who have turned the wheel of the Dharma in this way, and who have revealed nirvana.

original: kun du myur ba zhes bya ba'i rdzu 'phrul gyi stobs gnyis kyi mthus lus kyi sprin gyis phyogs bcu bkang ste /
analyzed: kun du myur ba zhes bya ba'i rdzu 'phrul gyi stobs gnyis kyi mthus lus kyi sprin gyis phyogs bcu bkang ste /
translated: In the presence of all of them, with the power of the two kinds of miraculous abilities called swiftness of mind and swiftness of action, one fills the ten directions with clouds of one's own body.

original: mchod pa'i sprin nam mkha' khebs pa'i dam pa bgrang ba las 'das pa thams cad kyis mchod pa dang / bstod cing brjod pa dang / bskor ba brgya stong du ma byed cing 'khor ba'i mtha'i bar 'gro ba ni bsnyen par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: mchod pa'i sprin nam mkha' khebs pa'i dam pa bgrang ba las 'das pa thams cad kyis mchod pa dang / bstod cing brjod pa dang / bskor ba brgya stong du ma byed cing 'khor ba'i mtha'i bar 'gro ba ni bsnyen par 'jug pa'o //
translated: One makes offerings with all the supreme clouds of offerings that fill the sky, which are beyond number, and one praises and recites them and circles them hundreds of thousands of times. To proceed in this way until the end of samsara is to enter into service.

original: rim par 'tshang rgya zhes bya ba @193b ni mngon par byang chub pa'o //
analyzed: rim par 'tshang rgya zhes bya ba @193b ni mngon par byang chub pa'o //
translated: In stages, one awakens refers to full awakening.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ston pa zhes bya'am /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ston pa zhes bya'am /
translated: To reveal nirvana refers to

original: rab tu zhi mtha' zhes bya ba ni tshig kha bskang ba'i phyir rnam grangs su rig par bya ste gtso bor bshad pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu zhi mtha' zhes bya ba ni tshig kha bskang ba'i phyir rnam grangs su rig par bya ste gtso bor bshad pa'o //
translated: The term “ultimate peace” should be understood as a synonym for “nirvana” in order to complete the meter; it is the primary explanation.

original: de yang chu zla'i gzugs brnyan bzhin du dga' ldan gnas kyi gzhal med khang na bzhugs pa las 'chi 'pho bstan pa dang / mngal na gnas pa'i tshe dang / lhas phyag byas pa dang / bzo bstan pa dang / mngon par byung nas rab tu byung ste dka' ba spyod pa dang /
analyzed: de yang chu zla'i gzugs brnyan bzhin du dga' ldan gnas kyi gzhal med khang na bzhugs pa las 'chi 'pho bstan pa dang / mngal na gnas pa'i tshe dang / lhas phyag byas pa dang / bzo bstan pa dang / mngon par byung nas rab tu byung ste dka' ba spyod pa dang /
translated: Moreover, like the reflection of the moon in water, he demonstrated passing away from the palace in the Tuṣita heaven, being in the womb, being worshipped by the gods, learning the arts, going forth into the homeless state, practicing austerities,

original: byang chub kyi snying por bzhud nas byang chub shing drung du seng ge'i gdan la bzhugs pas bdud pham par mdzad pa'i dus su gong ma bzhin nye bar 'gro ba ni de dag gi zhabs kyi drung du yud tsam gyis so //
analyzed: byang chub kyi snying por bzhud nas byang chub shing drung du seng ge'i gdan la bzhugs pas bdud pham par mdzad pa'i dus su gong ma bzhin nye bar 'gro ba ni de dag gi zhabs kyi drung du yud tsam gyis so //
translated: going to the seat of awakening, and sitting on the seat of awakening beneath the Bodhi tree. At the time of conquering the demons, he went to them in an instant, as before.

original: stobs de rnam pa bcu gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: stobs de rnam pa bcu gnyis pa'o //
translated: This is the twelfth power.

original: de dag kyang rnam pa bcu ste tshigs bcad gnyis kyis so //
analyzed: de dag kyang rnam pa bcu ste tshigs bcad gnyis kyis so //
translated: These are the ten powers.

original: de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: rdzu 'phrul stobs rnams dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul stobs rnams dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The power of miracles, etc.

original: 'phrul par byed pas rdzu 'phrul zhes bya bas na ji ltar 'dod pa phun sum tshogs par byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'phrul par byed pas rdzu 'phrul zhes bya bas na ji ltar 'dod pa phun sum tshogs par byed pa ste /
translated: It is a miracle because it is a marvel, and it is a marvel because it is a perfect fulfillment of wishes.

original: cho 'phrul zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: cho 'phrul zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is a marvel because it is a marvel to the world.

original: rdzu 'phrul ji ltar cho 'phrul du shes par bya zhe na /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul ji ltar cho 'phrul du shes par bya zhe na /
translated: How is the miracle to be known?

original: so so'i sems can rnams kyi yid 'phrog cing mgu bar byed pas na cho 'phrul lo //
analyzed: so so'i sems can rnams kyi yid 'phrog cing mgu bar byed pas na cho 'phrul lo //
translated: It is a marvel because it captivates and delights the minds of individual beings.

original: de'i stobs kyis gdon mi za bas na rdzu 'phrul gyi stobs so //
analyzed: de'i stobs kyis gdon mi za bas na rdzu 'phrul gyi stobs so //
translated: It is a power of miracles because it is a power of miracles by means of that marvel.

original: kun du myur ba'i zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i gzhan du 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: kun du myur ba'i zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i gzhan du 'gro ba'o //
translated: Swift in all ways is the bodhisattva's going elsewhere.

original: 'gro ba na kun du myur ba'i rdzu 'phrul gyis skad cig gis phyogs bcur mi thogs par 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba na kun du myur ba'i rdzu 'phrul gyis skad cig gis phyogs bcur mi thogs par 'gro ba'o //
translated: It is swift in all ways because it is a swift miracle, going in an instant to the ten directions without obstruction.

original: theg pa'i stobs zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po'i stobs kyis te /
analyzed: theg pa'i stobs zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po'i stobs kyis te /
translated: The power of the vehicle is the power of the Great Vehicle.

original: de bas na theg pa chen po des theg pas na theg pa chen po'o //
analyzed: de bas na theg pa chen po des theg pas na theg pa chen po'o //
translated: Therefore, because one goes by means of that Great Vehicle, it is the Great Vehicle.

original: yang na byang chub sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa yin pas na /
analyzed: yang na byang chub sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa yin pas na /
translated: Or else, it is the vehicle of the great bodhisattvas.🔽

original: theg pa chen po ste /
analyzed: theg pa chen po ste /
translated: Or else, it is the Great Vehicle because it is the vehicle of the great bodhisattvas.

original: dngos su na sangs rgyas kyi byang chub thob par byed pa'i lam bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs gnyis la theg pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dngos su na sangs rgyas kyi byang chub thob par byed pa'i lam bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs gnyis la theg pa zhes bya'o //
translated: In fact, the path that leads to the attainment of the enlightenment of the Buddha is called the vehicle, because it is the accumulation of both merit and wisdom.

original: yang na pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang bcas pa la theg pa chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang bcas pa la theg pa chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: Or else, the Great Vehicle is so called because it is endowed with the perfections.

original: de dag gi stobs ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi stobs ji snyed pas mi chom pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi stobs ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi stobs ji snyed pas mi chom pa'o //
translated: Its power is such that it cannot be crushed by any power that is opposed to it.

original: kun nas sgo'i zhes bya ba ni kun gyi sgo ste /
analyzed: kun nas sgo'i zhes bya ba ni kun gyi sgo ste /
translated: The “universal door” is the door to everything.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: de'i lus dang dmigs pa ni byang chub tu sems bskyed cing gzhan la phan par mi byed pa gang yang @194a * //
analyzed: de'i lus dang dmigs pa ni byang chub tu sems bskyed cing gzhan la phan par mi byed pa gang yang @194a * //
translated: There is nothing that is not included in the bodhisattvas’ bodies and objects, since they generate the thought of enlightenment and work for the benefit of others.

original: med pa'o // de ni 'phags pa spyod yul yongs su dag pa'i mdo la ltos shig / spyod pa'i stobs rnams zhes bya ba ni spyod pa gnyis ka bye brag med pa'i stobs te /
analyzed: med pa'o // de ni 'phags pa spyod yul yongs su dag pa'i mdo la ltos shig / spyod pa'i stobs rnams zhes bya ba ni spyod pa gnyis ka bye brag med pa'i stobs te /
translated: The “powers of practice” are the powers of both kinds of practice, without distinction.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i stobs dang / kun du bzang po'i spyod pa'i stobs kyis so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i stobs dang / kun du bzang po'i spyod pa'i stobs kyis so //
translated: by the power of the bodhisattva's practice, and by the power of the practice of universal excellence.

original: kun du yon tan zhes bya ba ni thog ma dang bar ma dang tha mar dge ba'o //
analyzed: kun du yon tan zhes bya ba ni thog ma dang bar ma dang tha mar dge ba'o //
translated: Universal virtue means virtue in the beginning, middle, and end.

original: byams pa dag gi stobs zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi khams thams cad la bde bar sems pas khyab pa'o //
analyzed: byams pa dag gi stobs zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi khams thams cad la bde bar sems pas khyab pa'o //
translated: The power of love means the pervasion of the realm of all sentient beings with the thought of happiness.

original: kun du khyab pa zhes bya ba ni phyogs bcur khyab pa'o //
analyzed: kun du khyab pa zhes bya ba ni phyogs bcur khyab pa'o //
translated: Universal pervasion means pervasion of the ten directions.

original: bsod nams stobs zhes bya ba ni dag cing gtsang bar byed pas na bsod nams so //
analyzed: bsod nams stobs zhes bya ba ni dag cing gtsang bar byed pas na bsod nams so //
translated: The power of merit means merit, because it purifies and cleanses.

original: yang na phyi phyir zhes bsod par 'gyur bas na bsod nams so //
analyzed: yang na phyi phyir zhes bsod par 'gyur bas na bsod nams so //
translated: Alternatively, it is merit because it becomes better and better.

original: de'i stobs ni byang chub tu sems bskyed pa bsgoms pa las byung ba ste /
analyzed: de'i stobs ni byang chub tu sems bskyed pa bsgoms pa las byung ba ste /
translated: Its power is the cultivation of the generation of the thought of enlightenment.

original: 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: byang chub sems kyi bsod nams gang //
analyzed: byang chub sems kyi bsod nams gang //
translated: Whatever merit there is in the thought of enlightenment,

original: gal te de ni gzugs gyur na //
analyzed: gal te de ni gzugs gyur na //
translated: if it were to take on a visible form,

original: nam mkha'i khams kyang gang gyur cing //
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams kyang gang gyur cing //
translated: it would fill the whole realm of space

original: de bas de ni lhag par 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas de ni lhag par 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs so //
translated: and extend beyond that.

original: de bas na theg pa chen po dang ldan pa'i dam pa'i chos zab cing rgya che ba rnams 'dzin pa dang / klog pa dang / 'chad pa dang / mos nas tshigs bcad gnyis tsam yang bzung nas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu bsngo bar gyur par de'i bsod nams kyi stobs so //
analyzed: de bas na theg pa chen po dang ldan pa'i dam pa'i chos zab cing rgya che ba rnams 'dzin pa dang / klog pa dang / 'chad pa dang / mos nas tshigs bcad gnyis tsam yang bzung nas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu bsngo bar gyur par de'i bsod nams kyi stobs so //
translated: Therefore, the power of his merit is that he upholds, reads, explains, and believes in the profound and extensive true Dharma of the Great Vehicle, and even if he upholds just two lines of verse, he dedicates them to perfect complete enlightenment.

original: kun nas dge ba'i zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad la dge ba dang phan pa sems shing sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun nas dge ba'i zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad la dge ba dang phan pa sems shing sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase completely virtuous means that he thinks and practices virtue and benefit for all sentient beings.

original: ye shes stobs zhes bya ba ni shes par bya ba thams cad la shes par byed pa ni ye shes so //
analyzed: ye shes stobs zhes bya ba ni shes par bya ba thams cad la shes par byed pa ni ye shes so //
translated: The phrase the power of wisdom means that wisdom is what causes one to know all that is to be known.

original: chags pa med par gyur pa'i zhes bya ba ni dus gsum du mi thogs pa'o //
analyzed: chags pa med par gyur pa'i zhes bya ba ni dus gsum du mi thogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase becomes free from attachment means that he is not obstructed in the three times.

original: shes rab kyi stobs zhes bya ba ni dngos po rnams ji lta ba bzhin rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi stobs zhes bya ba ni dngos po rnams ji lta ba bzhin rtogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase the power of wisdom means that he realizes things just as they are.

original: thabs kyi stobs zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba'i rigs pa ni thabs te sgrub pa'i stobs la thogs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: thabs kyi stobs zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba'i rigs pa ni thabs te sgrub pa'i stobs la thogs pa med pa'o //
translated: The power of means is the reason for accomplishment, which is the power of accomplishment without obstruction.

original: ting 'dzin stobs zhes bya ba ni stobs dang byed pa'i ting nge 'dzin te bsam gtan no //
analyzed: ting 'dzin stobs zhes bya ba ni stobs dang byed pa'i ting nge 'dzin te bsam gtan no //
translated: The power of concentration is the concentration of power and action, which is meditation.

original: de'i mthus 'gro ba thams cad kyi don bya ba'i phyir mngon par shes pa la sogs pa'i yon tan sdud pa la mi thogs pa de ni ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs so //
analyzed: de'i mthus 'gro ba thams cad kyi don bya ba'i phyir mngon par shes pa la sogs pa'i yon tan sdud pa la mi thogs pa de ni ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs so //
translated: By its power, one is able to gather the qualities of superknowledge and so forth in order to benefit all beings. This is the power of concentration.

original: grong nas grong gzhan du ;
analyzed: grong nas grong gzhan du ;
translated: from town to town,

analyzed: mtshams med pa la sogs pa lci ba rnams thams cad kyi thams cad du 'byang ba ji ltar 'gyur zhes zer pa de dag kyang yod do //
